intro: Icacorea campanensis, commonly known as the bell-icacara, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
